name: 3-fluoro-4-methoxybenzenesulfonamide
Reason: 3-fluoro-4-methoxybenzenesulfonamide has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is 4-methoxybenzenesulfonamide, which has a melting point of around 100 degrees Celsius. The fluorine atom introduces a significant increase due to the increased molecular weight and rigidity of the structure, estimated at around +10 degrees Celsius. The methoxy group also contributes to the melting point due to increased molecular weight and possible hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +5 degrees Celsius. The sulfonamide group introduces a rigid structure with potential hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +10 degrees Celsius. The presence of a fluorine atom also introduces a significant increase due to the increased molecular weight and rigidity of the structure, estimated at around +10 degrees Celsius.
